availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bayles Earle Oates (Muhlenberg County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth J. Randolph Oates in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, on January 25, 1831. Father of William R. Oates, Charles R. Oates, Elizabeth J. Oates, Amaretta Princette Oates, Sarah F. Oates, Samuel P. Oates, Thomas J. Oates, James W. Oates, Laura E. Oates, Virgil Oates, and Lillian Oates. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
